name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text:
Our tour today is over. 

We are now meeting to share our initial impressions and ideas to help alleviate some of the hardships for migrants and how to empower the agencies on the ground in Texas to do a better job.

Our press conference will be streamed live on Facebook.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: These images are being posted publicly and are available for media use.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: This is a play pen for toddlers who came to the border unaccompanied. This is an unbelievable situation where horrific conditions are the first hope at a better life in America. https://t.co/bhjrCVFlfx

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: I do not always have the right thing to say. But, I am a father to 8 amazing kids and I think of them. These kids here in Texas are so tough. They came to America with hope of a better life. We have to move past the partisan rhetoric and do what is right for innocent children. https://t.co/xiSLNMDmkF

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: This is a beautiful baby that I just met. He was brought here by a man whose DNA did not match his. This is huge problem, men are kidnapping innocent children and using them to get across the border. This is bigger than political party. These are innocent kids and we have to help https://t.co/wDo2J7ukt9

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: Men without children are being held longer. There are no facilities to move them too. https://t.co/XNfQaXa5ei

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: Young men here are in bunkbeds. 4-6 to a room. I met a very kind young man from Guatemala whose parents saved up to send him to the United States. Life there is bad and there are few opportunities for young people.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: Now touring HHS facilities where boys ages 13-17 stay. Average stay is 55 days. Longest stay in the facility was 600 days before reunification.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: We are being told that there are two microwaves to feed all of the migrants coming through Port of Hidalgo. Some days there are as many as 2000 people seeking entry.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: These images are posted publicly and available for media use.

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text:
*sound on*

We are heading across the bridge to Mexico https://t.co/bfLOEFqtAP

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: Having frank and at times difficult conversations with the immigration officials here. I feel like they are being honest and straightforward about the situation here at Hidalgo-I have very grateful for their time and insight. https://t.co/mCs0BF7qkL

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text:
Now at the Port of Hidalgo. 

This line of cars is lined up to come in via the Port. Many people are transported here by cartels for thousands of dollars. 

Folks are here for 24-48 hours and released to Catholic charities. https://t.co/ZuQuDOACMk

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text:
It is snack time for the kids here at the processing facility. 

We are talking to them about what it is like here and how they are doing. 

This "pod" is for women and children. https://t.co/Wov2lmjPqr

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweet_text: Here in McAllen, Texas. Having our first meeting with Border Patrol officers. This facility processes families only for 24-48 hours. https://t.co/g2L49BDmq3
